main_definition: A badge is a small object, often in the form of a pin or emblem, worn to display an achievement, affiliation, or identity.

meanings_and_examples.example: The employee wore his company badge at all times while on duty.
She proudly displayed her 'Employee of the Month' badge on her desk.
The Boy Scouts have a variety of different types of badges that signify completion of specific training or ranks.
He wore a medical badge on his shirt to indicate he had diabetes in case of emergency.
The police officer pinned her badge onto her uniform, indicating she was an authorized member of the force.
